p: Focant and coworkers applied GCÃ—GC-TOFMS to analyse odour volatiles for forensic applications, covering cadavers, blood, environmental pollutants, chemical odour products and explosives [ 149, 154, 155, 156, 157, 158, 159, 160, 161, 162, 163, 164]. They evaluated the composition of some commercial chemical mixtures of odorants used in the training of cadaveric detection dogs, to mimic the human decomposition smell. The authors reported seven compounds present in products that are not related to cadaveric decomposition, indicating that these may not be suitable for the stated purpose [ 150].
